text:
Intel has announced at Intel Developer Forum
(IDF) 2015 that it will bring its new 3D Xpoint

memory to market next year under the brand
name Optane.

Optane will be 7 times faster than today's
solid state drives. Optane drives will include

a specialized software stack, Intel’s custom
storage controllers, and the 3D Xpoint memory.

3D XPoint doesn’t just boost speed: it increases
storage density, too. Its stacked design keeps

things compact, and the memory doesn’t need
to make room for transistors. 3D XPoint can

read from or write to individual memory cells
by simply altering voltages.

Intel says the technology is affordable enough
that Optane drives will be made available

next year for uses ranging from large corporate
data centers to lightweight laptops. They

would improve gaming, supercomputers, and
data analysis.
